profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Saturday December 8, 2018 at 00:21

did.abstract: Collection of 2,292 black-and-white photographs of Japanese painting arranged according to the following sub-collections: (705-1) Japanese Painting from the Freer Gallery of Art, Washington, D.C., and the Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York, (705-2) Japanese Painting from the Asian Art Museum, San Francisco, (705-3) Japanese Painting and Sculpture from the Brooklyn Museum, (705-4) Japanese Painting from Japanese Collections and Museums.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright has not been transferred to Yale University. Further use of this material may be subject to the copyright laws of the United States (Title 17, United States Code) or to site license or other rights management terms or conditions.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Arts of Japan Photograph Collection, Arts Library, Yale University

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Collection of 2,292 black-and-white photographs of Japanese painting arranged according to the following sub-collections: (705-1) Collection of photographs of Japanese painting in the Freer Gallery and Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York. Selection of photographs directed by Carolyn Wheelwright and funded by the Council on East Asian Studies. Each photograph is labeled in English with Museum name and negative number on reverse (Freer) or negative number on reverse (Metropolitan). Further identification information is enclosed in each folder. Organized by period, artist, or school/style. Provenance: Purchase, Freer Gallery of Art and Metropolitan Museum of Art, New York; ca. 1981-1990. Physical Description: 1,060 black-and-white 8 x 10 inch photographs (unmounted)

(705-2) Collection of photographs of Japanese paintings from the Asian Art Museum, San Francisco. Individual photographs labeled on reverse with title, artist, object ID, and medium information given in English. Organized according to object identification number (B60D5 â€“ B76D6). Selection of photographs directed by Carolyn Wheelwright and funded by the Council on East Asian Studies. Provenance: Purchase, Asian Art Museum, San Francisco; ca. 1981-1990. Physical Description: 194 black-and-white 8 x 10 inch photographs (unmounted).

(705-3) Collection of photographs of Japanese sculpture and painting from the Brooklyn Museum. Each photograph is identified and labeled in English on reverse. Provenance: Purchase, Brooklyn Museum. Date of purchase unknown. Physical Description: Purchase, Brooklyn Museum. Date of purchase unknown.

(705-4) Collection of photographs of Japanese paintings from various collections and museums in Japan. Selection of photographs originally directed by Carolyn Wheelwright, and funded by the Council on East Asian Studies. Identification information given in English on folders. Organized according to collection or museum name. Provenance: Purchase, direct. No further documentation found. Physical Description: 1,028 black-and-white photographs (unmounted), up to 10 x 12 inches.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Organized by sub-collection. See individual sub-collection information sheets.
